messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 3136
messages.msgSnippet: ... I ve had many a student quit because they were tierd of toting the instrument around.  Some school districts give cellists two instruments because that way
messages.messageBody:
3/13/03 19:38:

> I was supposed to earn my way through college playing the violin. I played
> for 5 years and was pretty good at it, but quit in high school. My memory
> of quitting is that I was tired of having to carry the violin around, back
> and forth to school and home for practice and use at both places.
>
> Dh says that is ridiculous, that nobody would ever quit for that reason.

I've had many a student quit because they were tierd of toting the
instrument around. Some school districts give cellists two instruments
because that way the kids are less likely to quit.

Violin is smaller but an extra burden with a heavy backpack. But I could
easily see you getting tierd of the expectations, too.

brenda
